title: Matchsafe, "Advertisement for Cigar Maker's Union #97, Boston", patented 1905
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, rounded corners, featuring man with black hair in black suit, white shirt, blue tie; he stands behind glass counter, holding with right hand a large box of cigars; inscription above reads "Look for the Union Label on the Box." Right side panel inscribed "Compliments of Cigarmakers Union #97, Boston, Mass." in black on orange ground. Left side panel inscribed "Not made by the Trust" in black and red on orange ground. Reverse inscription "Honesty, Skill & Cleanliness, Your Protection, Smoke Union Made Cigars," in black and red on orange ground flanks green facimili of "Union-made Cigars Local Stamp." Lid hinged on side. Striker on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Advertisement for Cigar Maker's Union #97, Boston", patented 1905.
patented 1905. Plated metal, printed celluloid. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-23.
